00032 //========================================================================
00033 // GameCodeError
00034 //
00035 // Not described in the book, but a nice start for a comprehensive
00036 // error handler.
00037 //
00038 //========================================================================
00039 
00040 #define GCERR_INIT_NOT_ENOUGH_DISK_SPACE                1
00041 #define GCERR_INIT_CPU_TOO_SLOW                                 2
00042 #define GCERR_INIT_NOT_ENOUGH_PHYS_RAM                  3
00043 #define GCERR_INIT_NOT_ENOUGH_VIRT_RAM                  4
00044 #define GCERR_INIT_NOT_ENOUGH_CONTIG_RAM                5
00045 
00046 #define GCERR_ABORT                                                             1
00047 #define GCERR_RETRY                                                             2
00048 #define GCERR_IGNORE                                                    3
00049 
00050 class GameCodeError
00051 {
00052 protected:
00053         const int m_Code;
00054 public:
00055         GameCodeError(const int code)
00056                 : m_Code(code)
00057                 { }
00058 
00059         int Handle() { return GCERR_ABORT; }
00060         // provided assignment operator since that can not be generated, since member data is
00061         // const ... my suspiscion however is that m_Code should not, itself, be const ... -taj
00062         GameCodeError & operator=( GameCodeError & o )
00063         {
00064                 if ( this != &o )
00065                 {
00066                         int & intRef = const_cast<int&>(m_Code); // circumvent const state The Right Way
00067                         intRef = o.m_Code;
00068                 }
00069 
00070                 return *this;
00071         }
00072 };
